Typealiases.html#/Color.name: Color
Typealiases.html#/Color.abstract: Typealias used for colors. It maps to UIColor.

Typealiases.html#/Font.name: Font
Typealiases.html#/Font.abstract: Typealias used for fonts. It maps to UIFont.

Typealiases.html#/s:7Capable5Colora.name: Color
Typealiases.html#/s:7Capable5Colora.abstract: Typealias used for colors. It maps to NSColor.

Typealiases.html#/s:7Capable4Fonta.name: Font
Typealiases.html#/s:7Capable4Fonta.abstract: Typealias used for fonts. It maps to NSFont.

Typealiases.html#/Image.name: Image
Typealiases.html#/Image.abstract: Typealias used for images. It maps to UIImage.

Typealiases.html#/s:7Capable5Imagea.name: Image
Typealiases.html#/s:7Capable5Imagea.abstract: Typealias used for image. It maps to NSImage.

Structs/HandicapStatus.html#/s:7Capable1.name: statusString
Structs/HandicapStatus.html#/s:7Capable1.abstract: The Handicap‘s status (enabled or disabled). Note that the status depends on the Handicap’s enabledIf value (see HandicapEnabledMode).

Structs/Handicap.html#/s:7Capable8Handic.name: features
Structs/Handicap.html#/s:7Capable8Handic.abstract: A list of CapableFeatures that are expected to be enabled if a user has this handicap.

Structs/Handicap.html#/s:7Capable8Handic.name: name
Structs/Handicap.html#/s:7Capable8Handic.abstract: The name of the Handicap that can be used to uniquely identify the Handicap. This name is also used inside the status map.

Structs/Handicap.html#/s:7Capable8Handic.name: enabledIf
Structs/Handicap.html#/s:7Capable8Handic.abstract: This mode defines whether all features need to be enabled to set the Handicap‘s status to enabled or only one of them.

Structs/FeatureStatus.html#/s:7Capable13.name: statusString
Structs/FeatureStatus.html#/s:7Capable13.abstract: The feature’s status: While most features can only have a status set to enabled or disabled, the ‘.largerText` feature offers the font scale set by the user.

Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV12wit.name: init(withFeatures:)
Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV12wit.abstract: Initializes the framework instance with a specified set of features. If no feature was provided, this defaults to all features available on the current platform.

Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV13wit.name: init(withHandicaps:)
Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV13wit.abstract: Initializes the framework instance with a set of Handicaps.

Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV9stat.name: statusMap
Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV9stat.abstract: The statusMap property returns a dictionary of all CapableFeatures or Handicaps , that the Capable instance has been initialized with along with their current statuses. This object is compatible with most analytic SDKs such as Fabric Answers, Firebase Analytics, AppCenter Analytics, or HockeyApp.

Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV16isF.name: isFeatureEnabled(feature:)
Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV16isF.abstract: Provides information regarding the current status of a provided feature.

Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV17isH.name: isHandicapEnabled(handicapName:)
Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV17isH.abstract: Provides information regarding the current status of a provided Handicap.

Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV10min.name: minLogType
Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV10min.abstract: The minimum log level that should be considered when logging messages. Note that the custom ‘onLog’ closure will only be called for messages of this log type or higher. This value defaults to OSLogType.debug.

Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV5onLo.name: onLog
Structs/Capable.html#/s:7CapableAAV5onLo.abstract: A custom closure that should be used by the logger for all Capable instances instead of the default os_log implementation.

Structs/Capable.html.name: Capable
Structs/Capable.html.abstract: This class defines the main interface of the Capable framework.

Structs/FeatureStatus.html.name: FeatureStatus
Structs/FeatureStatus.html.abstract: Model class that describes the content of a Capable notification (see Notification.Name.CapableFeatureStatusDidChange)

Structs/Handicap.html.name: Handicap
Structs/Handicap.html.abstract: Model class that groups a number of CapableFeatures to represent a user’s handicap.

Structs/HandicapStatus.html.name: HandicapStatus
Structs/HandicapStatus.html.abstract: Model class that describes the content of a Capable notification (see Notification.Name.CapableHandicapStatusDidChange)

Extensions/UIFont.html#/scaledFont(withN.name: scaledFont(withName:ofSize:)
Extensions/UIFont.html#/scaledFont(withN.abstract: Creates a scalable font with the given font name and reference font size.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/scaledSystemFont.name: scaledSystemFont(ofSize:)
Extensions/UIFont.html#/scaledSystemFont.abstract: Creates a scalable system font with a given reference font size.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/scaledBoldSystem.name: scaledBoldSystemFont(ofSize:)
Extensions/UIFont.html#/scaledBoldSystem.abstract: Creates a scalable bold system font with a given reference font size.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/scaledItalicSyst.name: scaledItalicSystemFont(ofSize:)
Extensions/UIFont.html#/scaledItalicSyst.abstract: Creates a scalable italic system font with a given reference font size.

Extensions/Notification/Name.html#/s:So1.name: CapableFeatureStatusDidChange
Extensions/Notification/Name.html#/s:So1.abstract: Name of the notification that gets fired whenever an observed accessibility feature status changes.

Extensions/Notification/Name.html#/s:So1.name: CapableHandicapStatusDidChange
Extensions/Notification/Name.html#/s:So1.abstract: Name of the notification that gets fired whenever an observed Handicap status changes.

Extensions/Notification/Name.html.name: Name
Extensions/Notification/Name.html.abstract: Extension that defines notification names provided by the Capable framework.

Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.name: getContrastRatio(forTextColor:onBackgroundColor:)
Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.abstract: Calculates the color ratio for a text color on a background color.

Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.name: getTextColor(onBackgroundColor:)
Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.abstract: Returns the text color with the highest contrast (black or white) for a given background color.

Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.name: getTextColor(fromColors:withFont:onBackgroundColor:conformanceLevel:)
Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.abstract: Calculates the contrast ratio of a given list of text colors and a background color. The first color that conforms to the conformance level defined gets returned. The default conformance level is .AA.

Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.name: getTextColor(onBackgroundImage:imageArea:)
Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.abstract: Returns the text color with the highest contrast (black or white) for a specific area of given background image.

Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.name: getTextColor(fromColors:withFont:onBackgroundImage:imageArea:conformanceLevel:)
Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.abstract: Calculates the contrast ratio of a given list of text colors and a specific area of given background image. The first color that conforms to the conformance level defined gets returned. The default conformance level is .AA.

Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.name: getBackgroundColor(forTextColor:)
Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.abstract: Returns the background color with the highest contrast (black or white) for a given text color.

Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.name: getBackgroundColor(fromColors:forTextColor:withFont:conformanceLevel:)
Extensions/Color.html#/s:So7NSColorC7Cap.abstract: Calculates the contrast ratio of a given list of background colors and a text color. The first color that conforms to the conformance level defined gets returned. The default conformance level is .AA.

Extensions/Color.html.name: Color
Extensions/Color.html.abstract: Extension that adds functionality for calculating WCAG compliant high contrast colors.

Extensions/UIFont.html.name: UIFont
Extensions/UIFont.html.abstract: Extension that adds functionality for creating scalable UIFont objects.

Enums/HandicapEnabledMode.html#/s:7Capab.name: oneFeatureEnabled
Enums/HandicapEnabledMode.html#/s:7Capab.abstract: The Handicap‘s status is enabled if one of its features is currently set to enabled.

Enums/HandicapEnabledMode.html#/s:7Capab.name: allFeaturesEnabled
Enums/HandicapEnabledMode.html#/s:7Capab.abstract: The Handicap‘s status is enabled if all its features are currently set to enabled.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/assistiveTouc.name: assistiveTouch
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/assistiveTouc.abstract: Menu that helps people with motor skill impairments to do certain actions or gestures by using a single tap.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/guidedAccess.name: guidedAccess
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/guidedAccess.abstract: Restricts access to certain features of a single app to keep the user focused.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/shakeToUndo.name: shakeToUndo
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/shakeToUndo.abstract: Deletes the last command by shaking the phone.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/speakScreen.name: speakScreen
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/speakScreen.abstract: Reads out the content of the current screen.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: fullKeyboardAccess
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: Enables users to navigate through items of the screen without having to use a mouse.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: increaseContrast
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: Increases contrast to make out text and interface elements.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/grayscale.name: grayscale
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/grayscale.abstract: Makes the display more readable for color blind people by using gray tones instead of colors.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/monoAudio.name: monoAudio
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/monoAudio.abstract: Merges stereo audio channels to help users that are hard of hearing or deaf in one ear.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/videoAutoplay.name: videoAutoplay
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/videoAutoplay.abstract: Allows users who are sensitive to motion to disable automatic video playback.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: differentiateWithoutColor
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: Helps color blind users to differentiate settings differently, e.g. by using shapes rather than colors.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: invertColors
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: Helps people with low vision, color blindness, or sensitivity to brightness to read the display content.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: reduceTransparency
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: Removes transparency from layers to make them readable for users with visual impairment.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: switchControl
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: Allows users with limited mobility to control their device with the help of ability switches and other adaptive devices.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: reduceMotion
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: Reduces animations to help users with motion sickness and epilepsy issues.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: voiceOver
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: The screen reader available on Apple platforms.

Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.name: keys(forFeatures:)
Enums/CapableFeature.html#/s:7Capable0A7.abstract: Iterates through a given list of feature types and returns an array containing the feature names as strings.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: bottomCenter
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The second horizontal third of the last vertical third.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: bottomLeft
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The first horizontal third of the last vertical third.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: bottomRight
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The last horizontal third of the last vertical third.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: center
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The second horizontal third of the second vertical third.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: centerLeft
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The first horizontal third of the second vertical third.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: centerRight
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The last horizontal third of the second vertical third.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: custom(rect:)
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: A custom area of the image defined by a CGRect.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: topCenter
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The second horizontal third of the first vertical third.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: topLeft
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The first horizontal third of the first vertical third.

Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.name: topRight
Enums/ImageArea.html#/s:7Capable9ImageAr.abstract: The last horizontal third of the first vertical third.

Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.name: AA
Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.abstract: The medium level of conformance including success criterias of level A.

Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.name: AAA
Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.abstract: The highest level of conformance including success criterias of level A and AA.

Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.name: failed
Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.abstract: Indicates that no level of conformance has been reached.

Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.name: init(contrastRatio:fontSize:isBoldFont:)
Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.abstract: Initializes a ConformanceLevel based on a given contrast ratio and font information used for the text.

Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.name: text
Enums/ConformanceLevel.html#/s:7Capable1.abstract: The text representation of the conformance level.

Enums/ConformanceLevel.html.name: ConformanceLevel
Enums/ConformanceLevel.html.abstract: An enum specifying all WCAG conformance levels.

Enums/CapableFeature.html.name: CapableFeature
Enums/CapableFeature.html.abstract: An enum specifying all features available on the current platform.

Enums/HandicapEnabledMode.html.name: HandicapEnabledMode
Enums/HandicapEnabledMode.html.abstract: This enum defines several modes which describe whether all features need to be enabled to set the Handicap‘s status to enabled or only one of them.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
